intro: Microlicia isophylla var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed microlicia, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
